PyBodyTrack - A Python library for motion quantification in videos.

class pybodytrack.utils.utils.Utils¶

Bases: object

static clean_dataframe(df)¶

Cleans a DataFrame by removing rows where the ‘timestamp’ column contains non-numeric values.

Parameters:

df (pandas.DataFrame) – DataFrame containing a ‘timestamp’ column.

Returns:

A cleaned DataFrame with only valid numeric timestamps.

Return type:

pandas.DataFrame

static convert_timestamp(timestamp)¶

Converts a timestamp to the format “dd/MM/yyyy hh:mm:ss”.

Parameters:

timestamp (float) – Timestamp in seconds.

Returns:

The formatted date and time as “dd/MM/yyyy hh:mm:ss”.

Return type:

str

static filter_dataframe_by_time(df, start_time, end_time)¶

Filters a DataFrame based on a given time range.

Parameters:

  • df (pandas.DataFrame) – DataFrame containing a ‘timestamp’ column.

  • start_time (float) – Start time of the range.

  • end_time (float) – End time of the range.

Returns:

Subset of the DataFrame where ‘timestamp’ is within the specified range.

Return type:

pandas.DataFrame

static get_day_and_month(timestamp)¶

Extracts the day and month from a timestamp.

Parameters:

timestamp (float) – Unix timestamp in seconds.

Returns:

A tuple containing the day and month as integers (day, month).

Return type:

tuple[int, int]

static get_object_by_key(objects, key)¶

Retrieves an object from a list by its key.

Parameters:

  • objects (List[Dict]) – A list of dictionaries with the structure {“key”: <key_value>, “values”: []}.

  • key (str) – The key to search for in the list.

Returns:

The object with the specified key, or None if not found.

Return type:

Optional[Dict]

static get_sub_landmark(df, columns)¶

Returns a sub-DataFrame containing only the specified columns.

Parameters:

  • df (pandas.DataFrame) – Original DataFrame.

  • columns (list) – List of column names to include in the sub-DataFrame.

Returns:

Sub-DataFrame with only the specified columns.

Return type:

pandas.DataFrame

static get_subframes_list(df, interval)¶

Splits a DataFrame into subframes based on a given time interval.

Parameters:

  • df (pandas.DataFrame) – DataFrame containing a ‘timestamp’ column.

  • interval (float) – Time interval for dividing the DataFrame.

Returns:

A list of subframes based on the specified time interval.

Return type:

list of pandas.DataFrame

static remove_empty_rows(df)¶

Removes entire rows that contain empty values (NaN, None, null) in any column.

Parameters:

df – Pandas DataFrame

Returns:

DataFrame without rows containing empty values
